member.name: T:OutSystems.Internal.SAP.SAPInternalContext
member.summary: Internal class used to store the context of a Rest Request. Should never be used directly. Use the OutSystems.RuntimePublic.REST.RestRequest class instead.

member.name: M:OutSystems.Internal.SAP.SAPInternalContext.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for SapContext. This class is for internal use only. Use the OutSystems.RuntimePublic.Sap.SapInvoke class instead.

member.name: M:OutSystems.Internal.SAP.SAPInternalContext.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:OutSystems.Internal.SAP.SAPInternalContext.GetActionName
member.summary: Returns the name of the REST API Method that invoked the extension.

member.name: M:OutSystems.Internal.SAP.SAPInternalContext.GetRfcConfigParameters
member.summary: Returns the RfcConfigParameters.

member.name: M:OutSystems.Internal.SAP.SAPInternalContext.SetRfcConfigParameters(SAP.Middleware.Connector.RfcConfigParameters)
member.summary: Sets the RfcConfigParameters.

member.name: M:OutSystems.Internal.SAP.SAPInternalContext.GetIRfcFunction
member.summary: Returns the current IRfcFunction being called.

member.name: M:OutSystems.Internal.SAP.SAPInternalContext.SetIRfcFunction(SAP.Middleware.Connector.IRfcFunction)
member.summary: Sets the IRfcFunction.

member.name: T:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPConnection
member.summary: Provides access to the SAP Connection used for consuming a SAP Remote Function.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPConnection.GetCurrent
member.summary: Returns the invoke object used by a SAP API. This method should only be used inside the OnBeforeConnection, OnBeforeInvoke or OnAfterInvoke callbacks of a SAP API.
member.returns: The SAP API invoke, or null when used outside the OnBeforeConnection, OnBeforeInvoke or OnAfterInvoke callbacks.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPConnection.GetRfcConfigParameters
member.summary: Returns the RfcConfigParameters that will be used to gather a RfcDestination

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPConnection.SetRfcConfigParameters(SAP.Middleware.Connector.RfcConfigParameters)
member.summary: Sets the RfcConfigParameters to be used to gather a RfcDestination.

member.name: T:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext
member.summary: Provides access to the SAP Transactional context for SAP Remote Functions

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.BeginContext(System.String)
member.summary: Marks the connection's context as manually controlled allowing the user to orchestrate 2 or more function calls in the same context.
member.param: The name of the SAP connection which context is to be manually controlled.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.BeginContext
member.summary: Marks any connections' context as manually controlled allowing the user to orchestrate 2 or more function calls in the same context.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.EndContext(System.String)
member.summary: Ends a manually controlled context.
member.param: The name of the SAP connection which context is to be terminated.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.EndContext
member.summary: Ends a manually controlled context.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.Commit(System.String)
member.summary: Commit the work performed so far in a manually controlled context.
member.param: The name of the SAP connection.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.Commit
member.summary: Commit the work performed so far in a manually controlled context.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.Rollback(System.String)
member.summary: Rollback any changes made so far in a manually controlled context.
member.param: The name of the SAP connection.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.Rollback
member.summary: Rollback any changes made so far in a manually controlled context.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.BeginStatelessRegion(System.String)
member.summary: Marks the connection's context as Stateless allowing the user to invoke BAPIs with implicit commits without the overhead of a stateful connection.
member.param: The name of the SAP connection which should be Stateless.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.BeginStatelessRegion
member.summary: Marks any connection's context as Stateless allowing the user to invoke BAPIs with implicit commits without the overhead of a stateful connection.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.EndStatelessRegion(System.String)
member.summary: Ends a Stateless region.
member.param: The name of the SAP connection which context is to be terminated.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPContext.EndStatelessRegion
member.summary: Ends a Stateless region.

member.name: T:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPRequest
member.summary: Provides access to the SAP request object used for consuming a SAP Remote Function.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPRequest.GetCurrent
member.summary: Returns the invoke object used by a SAP API. This method should only be used inside the OnBeforeConnection, OnBeforeInvoke or OnAfterInvoke callbacks of a SAP API.
member.returns: The SAP API invoke, or null when used outside the OnBeforeConnection, OnBeforeInvoke or OnAfterInvoke callbacks.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.SAP.SAPRequest.GetIRfcFunction
member.summary: Returns the current IRfcFunction being called. This method should only be used inside the OnBeforeInvoke or OnAfterInvoke callbacks of a SAP API.
